alert.note: Alert for Guernsey; Monroe; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 9:01AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected to continue. * WHERE...A portion of east central Ohio, including the following counties, Guernsey, Monroe and Noble. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 AM EST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cambridge, New Martinsville, Woodsfield, Caldwell, Byesville, Dudley, Quaker City, Sardis, Senecaville, Pleasant City, Clarington, Cumberland, Lore City, Summerfield, Belle Valley, Lewisville, Sarahsville, Dexter City, Salesville and Cameron. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
